item.title: Resizing a volume on a Virtual Machine guest without reboot
item.description:
How to add storage space to a VM guest varies greatly depending on configuration, needs, and even personal preference.

Here I will share how I do it on Ubuntu Server with an EXT formatted LVM root volume and separate boot partition. I will not cover resizing the virtual disk in VMware, VirtualBox, Parallels, etc.

item.title: Static IP on Raspbian
item.description:
This has already been written about many times, but I think there is a better way. Most people seem to be configuring static IP addresses with dhcpcd. I question: “Why run a DHCP client daemon just to set a static IP?”.

Here I will show how to configure a permanent static address without a DHCP client.

item.title: Secure Wipe Freespace on macOS
item.description:
Why

After deleting a file with sensitive info in it, or after editing sensitive info out of a file, the data still exists on disk until it’s overwritten.

Here is how you can overwrite all free space on your disk, or even wipe all space on a disk requiring it to be repartitioned and formatted.
